place.name: ST GEORGE
place.gazetteerText: GEORGE (St.), a township and a parish in St. Asaph district, Denbigh. The township lies on the verge of the county, 2½ miles SSE of Abergele r. station, and 5 WNW of St. Asaph; is sometimes called Llan-St. Sior; and has a post office under Rhyl. The parish contains also the townships of Dinorben and Myford; and is sometimes called Kegidog. Acres, returned with Abergele. Real property, £1, 940. Pop., 469. Houses, 106. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. Asaph. Value, £136.* Patron, the Prince of Wales. The church is good. . (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
